repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Judicial Reform Project; Third
            Structural Adjustment Credit Project; Reform Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Judicial Reform Project
            for Georgia were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            negligible, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory.
            Ratings for the Third Structural Adjustment Credit (SAC3)
            Project for Georgia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was high, Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also unsatisfactory. Ratings for the Reform
            Support Credit Project for Georgia were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the experience of the Judicial Reform
            Project shows that making the judiciary more independent,
            effective, adherent to higher ethical standards and
            professional requires interventions that go beyond
            rehabilitating infrastructure, using information technology,
            and educating the public. Establishment of an independent
            and effective judiciary requires strong political will and
            continuous commitment of the country authorities, which a
            Bank operation can only complement, but not substitute for.
            The experience of SAC3 and Reform Support Credits reiterates
            that Bank support can be effective in promoting and
            supporting change when the authorities are ready for reform,
            but not otherwise. When the authorities are not ready it
            could be argued that financial support may weaken the need
            for change and strengthen the capacity to maintain the
            status quo The experience of the Reform Support Credit shows
            that simpler rules reduce opportunities for corruption. When
            the government simplified the rules and streamlined
            administrative procedures in organizations like the traffic
            police, customs, and tax administration their staff
            delivered better services and extorted fewer bribes.

Georgia - Judicial Reform Project; Third
            Structural Adjustment Credit Project; Reform Support Credit Project

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Third Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC3) to the Republic of Georgia had a satisfactory outcome
            and a modest institutional development impact.  Project
            sustainability is unlikely, with satisfactory performances
            by both the Bank and the Borrower.  While SAC3 conditions
            were implemented, they did not have the desired impacts
            because of the poor governance environment. A number of
            external factors inhibited the impact of the SAC3 including:
            the Russian crisis of 1998; the presidential elections of
            2000; and rising tensions over border security issues in
            2002.  The Government has always supported the program, and
            has been willing to intervene where implementing agencies
            caused snags in implementation. Lessons learned include the
            following.  SAC3 would have been better served by a
            technical assistance project that supported not only
            discrete activities, but aimed at true capacity building.
            An operation with a significantly longer implementation time
            would have better suited the Georgian reform programs.  The
            Bank needs to be more realistic in estimating implementation
            time, particularly for a three tranche operation with many
            conditions.  The Bank needs to spend more time raising
            ownership of the program at the level of implementing
            agencies.  Finally, the quality of governance may dictate
            the impact and the sustainability of the operation.

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Third Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project supports the implementation of the Georgian
            Government's reform program to reduce macroeconomic
            imbalances, and to provide an adequate incentive structure
            for private sector development. The program includes
            measures to 1) strengthen fiscal performance while lessening
            the adverse impact of stabilization on the poor by ensuring
            budgetary provisions for basic health care, education, and
            social protection; 2) improve legislation and regulatory
            framework favorable to private sector growth; and 3)
            complete the process of ownership change and market
            liberalization. The Credit will be disbursed in three tranches.

docna.cdata!: Georgia - Third Structural Adjustment Credit Project

display_title.display_title:
Georgia - Third Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project
